title.native: 終末なにしてますか? 忙しいですか? 救ってもらっていいですか?
title.romaji: Shuumatsu Nani Shitemasu ka? Isogashii desu ka? Sukutte Moratte Ii desu ka?
title.english: WorldEnd: What are you doing at the end of the world? Are you busy? Will you save us?

description:
Five hundred years have passed since the humans went extinct at the hands of the fearsome and mysterious ‘Beasts’. The surviving races now make their homes up on floating islands in the sky, out of reach of all but the most mobile of Beasts.

Only a small group of young girls, the Leprechauns, can wield the ancient weapons needed to fend off invasions from these creatures. Into the girls’ unstable and fleeting lives, where a call to certain death could come at any moment, enters an unlikely character: a young man who lost everything in his final battle five hundred years ago, the last living human awakened from a long, icy slumber.

Unable to fight any longer, Willem becomes the father that the girls never had, caring for and nurturing them even as he struggles to come to terms with his new life, in which he feels the pain of helplessly waiting for his loved ones to return home from battle that his ‘Daughter’ once felt for him so long ago. Together, Willem and the girls gradually come to understand what family means and what is truly worth protecting.
synonyms: Do you have what THE END? Are you busy? Shall you save xxx?
末日时在做什么？有没有空？可以来拯救吗？
WorldEnd: What do you do at the end of the world? Are you busy? Will you save us?
Apa yang Engkau Lakukan Saat Akhir Dunia? Apakah Engkau Sibuk? Bisakah Engkau Menolongku?
เวิลด์เอนด์: วันสิ้นโลกนี้ทำอะไร ยุ่งหรือเปล่า มาช่วยเราได้ไหม
Конец человечества. Что ты будешь делать после того, как людей не стало?

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Fairy
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a fairy.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Parenthood
tags.description: Centers around the experience of raising a child.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yama_ic)

Yamashita is one of the key figures of the "Web Generation," being among the first to be recruited within the industry not after formal training but after demonstrating his talent by posting animated gifs online.

His first time standing out of the crowd was on [Birdy the Mighty Decode](https://anilist.co/anime/3974/Birdy-the-Mighty-Decode/). His animation favors expression above all else, to the point characters often bend out of shape when exposed to extreme forces and speeds. 

Despite this he still has a keen eye for delicate and realistic character animation, inspired by the likes of [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/Norio-Matsumoto), as demonstrated on both EDs for Birdy the Mighty Decode and [Shinsekai yori](https://anilist.co/anime/13125/From-the-New-World/) where he handled all aspects of the animation production. 

He is also adept in post production work, often handling the photography, coloring and even CG in his own works.

[Profile](www.horipro-international.com/artist/musician/tadokoro) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/azusa-tadokoro) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/AzusaTadokoro) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/azusa_tadokoro/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tadokoroazusaofficial)

She was a member in the tennis club at her middle and high schools, and she was also the general manager of the club in high school. When Azusa was in 8th grade, she was inspired to become a voice actress after hearing the Akiko Yajima's performance as Kohaku in Inuyasha. She participated in Horipro's 36th Talent Scout Caravan on October 11, 2011, was awarded as the grand prix winner and made her debut as a voice actress in 2012. In 2014, she made her official debut as a singer with the album "Beyond Myself!".

Azusa's hobbies including karaoke, impersonating, making albums, cooking and sewing. Her special skills include tennis - which she has been playing ever since fifth grade of elementary school - and arm wrestling, and she likes to stay healthy. She also loves both cows and movies, and has said that her ideal date would be either tennis or a movie so that she wouldn’t have to talk a lot. Azusa has four older brothers, and she went to the same high school as [Megumi Nakajima](https://anilist.co/staff/96105/Megumi-Nakajima)

(Source: BanG Dream! Wikia)

__[Profile (Scoop)](https://www.scoop.co.jp/creator/detail.php?cd=21)__

__Yousuke Yamashita__ is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger and keyboardist.

__Founded:__ 2015

__[Artist Profile (TOY'S FACTORY)](https://www.toysfactory.co.jp/artist/q_mhz)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/QMHz_info)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCUKcdgw725jOdQ6LfQNYZsA)__

__Introduction:__
Q-MHz is a Japanese music production team, consisting of various people from different bands.

__Members:__
- [Tomoya Tabuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/148232/Tomoya-Tabuchi), from the band [UNISON SQURE GARDEN](https://anilist.co/staff/119406/Unison-Square-Garden)
- [Tomokazu Tashiro](https://anilist.co/staff/148496)
- [Aki Hata](https://anilist.co/staff/106018), from the band Tsukihiko
- [Katsuhiko Kurosu](https://anilist.co/staff/149133), from the music production company [Peak A Soul+](https://www.peakasoul.net/)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/miho_karasawa)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/miho_karasawa/)__

Miho Karasawa is a Japanese singer who was previously signed to Horipro and is currently signed to Lantis.  Since 2014, she has performed under the stage name True (stylized as TRUE). 

She has performed theme songs for [Buddy Complex](https://anilist.co/anime/20533/), [Gargantia on the Verdurous Planet](https://anilist.co/anime/16524), [Maria the Virgin Witch](https://anilist.co/anime/20840) and [Sound! Euphonium](https://anilist.co/anime/20912/), among others. Karasawa made her debut in 2000 with the release of the song "Anytime, Anywhere".

__Founded:__ 2015

__[Artist Profile (TOY'S FACTORY)](https://www.toysfactory.co.jp/artist/q_mhz)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/QMHz_info)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCUKcdgw725jOdQ6LfQNYZsA)__

node.description:
__[Website](https://www.tamaru-web.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Tamaru_official)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tamaru_official/)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/yamadatamaru.official)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCICIpIBwtLq9S4sb_Tb3cQg)__

__Birthplace:__ Nerima-ku, Tokyo, Japan
__Graduated:__ Tokyo Metropolitan Nishi High School, Waseda University (Faculty of Literature)

__Introduction:__
Tamaru Yamada is a Japanese vocalist and lyricist, who has previously released music through record labels Edoya Co., LTD (2005-2006) and BMG JAPAN (2006-2008). She was also previously under the office POWERPLAY MUSIC (2006-2011), which is the same office UVERworld and Lenny code fiction is under. 

__Biography:__
Yamada Tamaru, a native of Japan, began her love for music near childhood when she would listen to jazz and country music. Her love of music has continued to grow over the years and thus she continues to refine her own music. In high school she formed a band, then later she would learn to compose music with as a pianist and guitarist. 

In 2006, Tamaru produced two albums through independent music, and made major debuts with the commercial song to SHIEIDOs "My Brand New Eden". She has expanded her talent and has appeared in a commercial for Yebisu Beer "The Hop" and so on. In recent times, you can find Tamaru performing at the various venues as a singer, and as an actress as well. You can additionally find Tamaru's music through Japanese TV anime such as [Full Metal Panic! Invisible Victory](https://anilist.co/anime/21451/Full-Metal-Panic-Invisible-Victory/) and [Shuumatsu Nani Shitemasu ka? Isogashii desu ka? Sukutte Moratte Ii desu ka?](https://anilist.co/anime/21860/Shuumatsu-Nani-Shitemasu-ka-Isogashii-desu-ka-Sukutte-Moratte-Ii-desu-ka/), while she also appears in commercials, dramas, movies and TV programs. Tamaru makes high quality songs and sings with a soulful voice. The voice and her vision of her creation envelop and captivate the people's heart.

On May 9, 2018, the album of Full Metal Panic!s' 'Operation Able' by Bandai Namco Arts was released and and turns out to be a big hit. Tamaru attracts a lot of attention, from both the Japanese and Western audence. On October 24, Tamaru released her first best-album 'YamadaTamaru ALL-TIME BEST Tokkuni Aishiteru' by Sony Music Direct, while also on December 22, 2018, she released a new song titled 'Koi wo Shinasai', which could only be attainted through distribution-only.

(Source: [Tamaru Yamada's Official Website](https://www.tamaru-web.com/profile), edited)
